title: Matti Lähitie
text:
Matti Lähitie (born 13 February 1985 in <a href="Pori">Pori</a>) is a <a href="Finland">Finnish</a> <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a>, currently playing for <a href="Jyv%C3%A4skyl%C3%A4n%20Jalkapalloklubi">Jyväskylän Jalkapalloklubi</a> (JJK) in the <a href="Finland">Finnish</a> <a href="Ykk%C3%B6nen">Ykkönen</a>. He plays as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> or defensive <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>.
Playing career.
Matti Lähitie started his <a href="Association%20football">football</a> career at <a href="Finland">Finnish</a> club FC Jazz, where he made his league debut at the age of just seventeen years old. In total he made forty appearances at FC Jazz between 2002 and 2004, scoring twice.
In 2005, he transferred to another <a href="Finland">Finnish</a> club, <a href="FC%20Lahti">FC Lahti</a> who were playing in <a href="Veikkausliiga">Veikkausliiga</a> at the time. Lähitie saw this as a step-up in his career, with <a href="Finland">Finnish</a> internationals such as <a href="Jari%20Litmanen">Jari Litmanen</a>, <a href="Pekka%20Lagerblom">Pekka Lagerblom</a> and <a href="Mika%20V%C3%A4yrynen">Mika Väyrynen</a> also playing for <a href="FC%20Lahti">Lahti</a> at some point and all benefiting.
In 2006 Lähitie transferred to his third <a href="Finland">Finnish</a> club, <a href="Jyv%C3%A4skyl%C3%A4n%20Jalkapalloklubi">Jyväskylän Jalkapalloklubi</a> playing in the <a href="Finland">Finnish</a> Ykkönen.
Lähitie is a very versatile midfielder, who is just as comfortable on the left side of midfield as he is on the right or in the centre, although his right foot is his strongest.
